intro: Rhammatophyllum, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its unique, spiny leaves and showy, often blue or purple flowers. These plants are typically found in coastal regions and can thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Rhammatophyllum species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and adaptability to harsh environments. They play a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and supporting local wildlife.
